O H A P. XLIX. Hebron.

FROM Jericho we proceed to Hebron, far off in situation, but next to it in dignity: yea, there was a time, when it went before Jerusalem itself in name and honour ;—namely, while -the first foundations of the kingdom of David were laid3 and, at· that time, Jericho was buried in rubbish, and Jerusalem was trampled upon by the profane feet of the Jebusites.

Hebron was placed, as in the mountainous country of Judea‚ so in a place very rocky, but yet in a very fruitful coast.
